title: DOEI: Dual Optimization of Embedding Information for Attention-Enhanced Class Activation Maps
author: Hongjie Zhu (Southwest Minzu University), Zeyu Zhang (The Australian National University), Guansong Pang (Singapore Management University), Xu Wang (Sichuan University), Shimin Wen (Southwest Minzu University), Yu Bai (Southwest Minzu University), Daji Ergu (Southwest Minzu University), ..., Yang Zhao (La Trobe University)
relevance_why: The paper introduces methods for optimizing embeddings, which can potentially enhance models in audio processing by applying similar techniques to improve feature representation in audio data.
background: The paper addresses weakly supervised semantic segmentation, which involves improving model performance with minimal annotated data by generating more accurate Class Activation Maps (CAMs).
contribution: The paper introduces the Dual Optimization of Embedding Information (DOEI) mechanism to solve inaccuracies in CAM generation, achieving significant improvements in segmentation performance across standard datasets.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods focus primarily on generating CAMs without effectively coupling semantic information, often resulting in inaccurate object localization due to false activations.
technical_comparison.novelty: The DOEI model enhances the interaction between image features and class activation responses using attention mechanisms for better representation.

key_innovation: DOEI amplifies high-confidence tokens and suppresses low-confidence ones during embedding optimization, allowing for more precise feature representations.
real_world_impact: Incorporating this technique may lead to better performance in real-world applications like image segmentation in autonomous vehicles, medical imaging, and resource management in AI, reflecting potential improvements in these sectors.
limitations: The paper does not explicitly mention limitations but could be affected by general reliance on the quality of the initial CAMs.

new_terms.Class Activation Maps (CAMs): **Class Activation Maps (CAMs)** visualize the regions of an image that contribute most to the class predictions made by a model, highlighting areas of interest for segmentation tasks.
new_terms.weakly supervised semantic segmentation: **Weakly supervised semantic segmentation (WSSS)** refers to models that generate segmentations based on limited supervisory signals, like image-level labels instead of pixel-wise annotations.

open_sourcing: Code will be available at https://github.com/AIGeeksGroup/DOEI
